page.title: 16Winster Carnival
page.content: Winster carnival or wakes week is the last week of June and has been held for several centuries.It commemorate the birthday of the Church's St.John the Baptist.The carnival starts with a service at church.There are bands and a procession headed by the carnival queen.The events include a tug-of-war, morris dancing,street stalls,barbecue, travelling theatree companies,discos and dancing,fancy dress.bike races,a road race,treasure trail,village sports,a six a side football game. There is a Winster Wakes Week cake recipe:- 175g butter Blend flour & butter,add 25g currants currants sugar and egg 250g flour to make into dough.Roll 175g sugar and cut into cakes.Bake 1 egg in moderate oven until golden.
